definitions: To make a deep, inarticulate sound in response to pain or despair.
To make a similar sound in response to pleasure or relief.
To make a low, mournful sound, as of wind or a creaking door.
To be laden or burdened with something heavy or excessive.
examples: He began to groan with pain.
The old floorboards groaned under their weight.
She let out a groan of satisfaction.
